publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-204# Ms Irene Oldfather: Removal of Patients from GP Lists—That the Parliament recognises the Scottish Executive’s commitment to a patient centred health service, but notes with concern the threat to public confidence posed by the perceived unfairness of the removal of a patient from a General Practitioner’s list and, while defending the right of doctors to terminate a relationship which is not working, calls upon the Executive to draw up plans to require General Practitioners to provide reasons when removing patients from their lists.

S1M-204# Ms Irene Oldfather: Removal of Patients from GP Lists—That the Parliament recognises the Scottish Executive’s commitment to a patient centred health service, but notes with concern the threat to public confidence posed by the perceived unfairness of the removal of a patient from a General Practitioner’s list and, while defending the right of doctors to terminate a relationship which is not working, calls upon the Executive to draw up plans to require General Practitioners to provide reasons when removing patients from their lists.
S1M-204# Removal of Patients from GP Lists (lodged on 14 October 1999) Ms Margo MacDonald*
S1M-204# Removal of Patients from GP Lists (lodged on 14 October 1999) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-204# Removal of Patients from GP Lists (lodged on 14 October 1999) Dr Elaine Murray*, Margaret Jamieson*

S1M-204# Ms Irene Oldfather: Removal of Patients from GP Lists—That the Parliament recognises the Scottish Executive’s commitment to a patient centred health service, but notes with concern the threat to public confidence posed by the perceived unfairness of the removal of a patient from a General Practitioner’s list and, while defending the right of doctors to terminate a relationship which is not working, calls upon the Executive to draw up plans to require General Practitioners to provide reasons when removing patients from their lists. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Nora Radcliffe, Dr Elaine Murray, Margaret Jamieson
S1M-204# Removal of Patients from GP Lists (lodged on 14 October 1999) Mr John McAllion*

S1M-204# Ms Irene Oldfather: Removal of Patients from GP Lists—That the Parliament recognises the Scottish Executive’s commitment to a patient centred health service, but notes with concern the threat to public confidence posed by the perceived unfairness of the removal of a patient from a General Practitioner’s list and, while defending the right of doctors to terminate a relationship which is not working, calls upon the Executive to draw up plans to require General Practitioners to provide reasons when removing patients from their lists. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Nora Radcliffe, Dr Elaine Murray, Margaret Jamieson, Mr John McAllion
S1M-204# Removal of Patients from GP Lists (lodged on 14 October 1999) Mr Murray Tosh*, Dr Richard Simpson*

S1M-204# Ms Irene Oldfather: Removal of Patients from GP Lists-That the Parliament recognises the Scottish Executive's commitment to a patient centred health service, but notes with concern the threat to public confidence posed by the perceived unfairness of the removal of a patient from a General Practitioner's list and, while defending the right of doctors to terminate a relationship which is not working, calls upon the Executive to draw up plans to require General Practitioners to provide reasons when removing patients from their lists. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Nora Radcliffe, Dr Elaine Murray, Margaret Jamieson, Mr John McAllion, Mr Murray Tosh, Dr Richard Simpson

S1M-204# Ms Irene Oldfather: Removal of Patients from GP Lists—That the Parliament recognises the Scottish Executive’s commitment to a patient centred health service, but notes with concern the threat to public confidence posed by the perceived unfairness of the removal of a patient from a General Practitioner’s list and, while defending the right of doctors to terminate a relationship which is not working, calls upon the Executive to draw up plans to require General Practitioners to provide reasons when removing patients from their lists. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Nora Radcliffe, Dr Elaine Murray, Margaret Jamieson, Mr John McAllion, Mr Murray Tosh, Dr Richard Simpson
S1M-204# Removal of Patients from GP Lists (lodged on 14 October 1999) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-204# Removal of Patients from GP Lists (lodged on 14 October 1999) Trish Godman*
S1M-204# Removal of Patients from GP Lists (lodged on 14 October 1999) Mr David Davidson*, Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-204# Ms Irene Oldfather: Removal of Patients from GP Lists—That the Parliament recognises the Scottish Executive’s commitment to a patient centred health service, but notes with concern the threat to public confidence posed by the perceived unfairness of the removal of a patient from a General Practitioner’s list and, while defending the right of doctors to terminate a relationship which is not working, calls upon the Executive to draw up plans to require General Practitioners to provide reasons when removing patients from their lists. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Nora Radcliffe, Dr Elaine Murray, Margaret Jamieson, Mr John McAllion, Mr Murray Tosh, Dr Richard Simpson, Tommy Sheridan, Trish Godman, Mr David Davidson, Cathy Jamieson
